alert.note: Alert for Burke; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Burke and southeastern Richmond Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 323 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gough, or 14 miles west of Waynesboro, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hephzibah, McBean, Gough, South Augusta, Blythe, Keysville, Ellwood, Diamond Lakes Regional Park, Bath-Edie and Pea Patch Aerodrome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central Georgia.
